results.title: Discovering the world (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Thinking”.
First of four studies of the development of thinking in children from five to ten. Shows how their drawing and painting expresses understanding of their environment and traces its development.

results.title: Discovering the music of Japan (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: In a beautiful teahouse setting, three of the major Japanese instruments - the Koto, the Samisen and the Shakuhachi - are shown. Historical background on each instrument and the ways they fit into current Japanese life are explained. Includes traditional Japanese singing and dancing, and a performance by an ensemble of the three instruments. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

Includes traditional Japanese singing and dancing, and a performance by an ensemble of the three instruments. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.brief_description: A visually interesting film that presents a range of both natural and man made patterns. Provides practical ideas for creating patterns.This video has some useful classroom teaching applications.

results.title: Discovering color. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Jack Stoops, Paul Burnford and Columbia Broadcasing System
results.brief_description: Discusses differences in color in terms of hue, value, and intensity. Demonstrates techniques of color-mixing and explores the variety of color seen daily in the world around us. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering aromatherapy
results.brief_description: An inspiring and easy to follow program which outlines the history of essential oils. Explores what aromatherapy is and examines the various ways it can be utilised to enhance quality of life. Includes information on sinusitus, hayfever, tension and stress, headaches, insomnia, PMT-pre-menstrual tension, burns, cuts, grazes, insect bites, travel sickness, arthritis and rheumatism, strains, sprains, childhood ailments, pets and beauty treatments. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE CONTENTS OF THIS VIDEO ARE FOR INFORMATION PURPOSES ONLY AND READ THE DISCLAIMER AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PROGRAM.

results.title: Discovering American folk music
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Reviews two main influences on the development of American folk music. Traces the history of one ballad from its original British version to its emergence in the West as the cowboy song, “Streets of Laredo”, and later in an African American blues version, “The St James Infirmary”.
results.description: Reviews two main influences on the development of American folk music. Traces the history of one ballad from its original British version to its emergence in the West as the cowboy song, “Streets of Laredo”, and later in an African American blues version, “The St James Infirmary”.

results.title: Discover Sweden
results.creator_credit: Dag Bengtsson, D Tranword Communications, J and Journal Films
results.brief_description: Provides a general introduction to the social geography of Sweden. Presents visual and factual information on landscape, industries, transport and settlement, banking systems, politics, and education. Focuses on the country’s people describing the sports they enjoy, their religion and social customs. Useful for regional studies of Europe. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
